Device Configuration and Management

Once the appropriate system profiles are configured, and if any 2G or 4G profles are configured or modified on the PW EMS, you can power on all vBBUs. Before doing so, ensure that they are pre-provisioned for the PW EMS system by using the vBBU Web Commisioning Tool (WCT). Refer to the Virtual Baseband Unit Server Commissioning Guide for more information about setting up a vBBU server and pre-provisioning a vBBU, its vNodes, and cells.

Use the tasks in this chapter to configure a vBBU and its associated vNodes, which includes metadata such as naming and location information. The PW EMS allows the configuration of user-specified vBBU names, vNode names, and cell names that help identify them when they are viewed in counters and statistics and various areas of the PW EMS GUI, such as the Device Summary window, and PW EMS Monitoring dashboards.

Default or available profiles can be applied to a vBBU and its vNodes, and service can be created for individual vNodes that can contain both 2G and 4G cells.

Multiple vBBUs and vNodes can be rebooted, their configurations changed or uploaded in a bulk process by using the tasks described in this chapter. Also, LTE and GSM service parameters can be viewed for a connected HetNet Gateway (HNG) and the status of all devices can be changed, monitored or modified.

  • Send vNode Information from the vBBU to PW EMS
    Use the vBBU Web Commisioning Tool on the vBBU server Web UI to send a vNode inventory report from the vBBU that informs the PW EMS about its vNodes so that these vNodes can be configured on the PW EMS.
  • Configure a vBBU
    Use this task to configure a discovered vBBU, its location, and select its profiles.
  • Configure a vNode
    Use this task to configure a new device (discovered vBBU or vNode), its location, and select its profiles.
  • Create a Bulk CSV File to Configure Multiple Devices
    Use this task to create a custom CSV file from a CSV file template provided by Parallel Wireless and upload it to configure multiple devices or create multiple devices at the same time.
  • View Device Summary Information
  • View vBBU Details
    Use this task to view vBBU operational server information.
  • View vNode Details
    Use this task to view vNode operational information.
  • View RRH Details
    Use this task to view Remote Radio Head (RRH) device operational information, which includes its cells.
  • View Device Locations
    Use this task to view discovered vBBU devices and their associated cells in the context of their respective physical locations.
  • View Cell Availability
    Use this task to check the availability of cells a after configuring service for GSM (2G) and LTE (4G) vNodes to which they are associated.
  • View HNG Service Parameters
    Use this task to create HetNet Gateway (HNG) GSM 2G or LTE 4G cell service parameters.
